content: after reading up on the requirements for the BMT, i learned that its required to shave everyday. idk much about shaving really anyways, and still trying to figure out the best number of blades, what kind of razors and number of blades should i use to be able to shave the way they make you there?
reply: after reading up on the requirements for the BMT, i learned that its required to shave everyday. idk much about shaving really anyways, and still trying to figure out the best number of blades, what kind of razors and number of blades should i use to be able to shave the way they make you there?
title: Shaving

content: Air Force? You'll always be close to electricity. Get a good rechargeable rotary electronic shaver. I used one for years both in the field and in garrison. Why mess with the mess when you don't have too? Wandering and Wondering
reply: Air Force? You'll always be close to electricity. Get a good rechargeable rotary electronic shaver. I used one for years both in the field and in garrison. Why mess with the mess when you don't have too? Wandering and Wondering

title: Shaving

content: quote: Originally posted by vansslim: dont you have to keep everything spotless clean lol If they still do Wall Lockers and Foot Lockers, you have stuff on display, and stuff you use in a small drawer or corner that is somewhat off limits, where you can keep letters and such. That is where you keep your shaver or razor you're using. The display stuff you keep strack and straight, never to touch except to dust - - But that was 30 years ago - - Besides, an electric shaver is a lot easier to clean than a soaped-up razor by far!! Wandering and Wondering
quote: Originally posted by vansslim: dont you have to keep everything spotless clean lol
reply: If they still do Wall Lockers and Foot Lockers, you have stuff on display, and stuff you use in a small drawer or corner that is somewhat off limits, where you can keep letters and such. That is where you keep your shaver or razor you're using. The display stuff you keep strack and straight, never to touch except to dust - - But that was 30 years ago - - Besides, an electric shaver is a lot easier to clean than a soaped-up razor by far!! Wandering and Wondering

title: Shaving

content: Don't try the original "epilady"!!!!! My girlfriend got one and she whined about how it was torture. She only did a little bit of one leg and couldn't handle it. I couldn't imagine it was that bad. She gave it to me to try it. I have a high pain tolerance but she said it was torture so I drank a few beers first. I did both legs, entirely from top to bottom....... Painful? ~~~~ HEWL YES! It pulls the hair out of the follicle. It looked and felt like I had stood in an ant bed for about an hour. I wanted to scratch the itching but instead I ran cold water over my legs and put lotion on but the pain wouldn't go away. I drank a few more beers and passed out. The next morning when I woke up the pain was gone and my legs were silky smooth for almost a whole month. Not worth the pain though. I gave it back to her and said, "NO THANK YOU, I WON'T BE DOING THAT AGAIN"! GOD BLESS AMERICA! GOD BLESS OUR MILITARY!
reply: Don't try the original "epilady"!!!!! My girlfriend got one and she whined about how it was torture. She only did a little bit of one leg and couldn't handle it. I gave it back to her and said, "NO THANK YOU, I WON'T BE DOING THAT AGAIN"! GOD BLESS AMERICA! GOD BLESS OUR MILITARY!

title: Shaving

content: Vansslim, I assume yer young and don't have much more than peach fuzz. You can buy a package of diposable razors, one razor might last a week. As your whiskers get heavier, you can consider a regular razor. I use a Gillette Mach 3, it gives a real good shave. I use Edge Shave Gel, I think it's the best. I have a Braun electric shaver, I use it as well, but it does not give a close shave like the Gillette Mach 3. Hope that helps! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!
reply: Vansslim, I assume yer young and don't have much more than peach fuzz. You can buy a package of diposable razors, one razor might last a week. As your whiskers get heavier, you can consider a regular razor. I use a Gillette Mach 3, it gives a real good shave. I use Edge Shave Gel, I think it's the best. I have a Braun electric shaver, I use it as well, but it does not give a close shave like the Gillette Mach 3. Hope that helps! Keep smiling, everyone will wonder what you've been up to!

content: quote: Originally posted by greywolfghost: Air Force? You'll always be close to electricity. Get a good rechargeable rotary electronic shaver. I used one for years both in the field and in garrison. Why mess with the mess when you don't have too? I've been using one for a few years now and, while it's true that their use eliminates a lot of the hassle of blade shaving, the results would never pass even a cursory inspection in my Marine Corps! It is not our belief or disbelief that can make or unmake the fact. ~ Thomas Paine
